thread.title: Rugby fans warned about train service delays
thread.title_full: Rugby fans warned about train service delays | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Rugby fans warned about train service delays
text:
Rugby fans heading to Cardiff for Wales' first game of the Rugby World Cup have been warned to allow extra time due to large crowds using train services.
Dan Kingdom @DanKingdom96 Follow On the way to Cardiff for #WALvURU ...made it to Bristol on a packed train. Now for another packed train. http://t.co/3A62NPJ3Z2
11:41 - 20 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Arriva Trains Wales @ArrivaTW Follow Trains to Cardiff Central are very busy today with many fans heading to #WAL v #URU - you should allow extra time to complete your journey.
11:49 - 20 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Arriva Trains Wales @ArrivaTW Follow We have provided extra capacity where possible on routes into Cardiff but trains will still be busy with lots of rugby fans today.
11:52 - 20 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Yesterday, First Great Western apologised to passengers for delays and 'severe overcrowding' on train services towards Cardiff ahead of the Millennium Stadium's game of the tournament.
Read More: Rugby fans' frustration over 'chaos' on train services
Last updated Sun 20 Sep 2015 Read more 8 updates First Great Western apologises to rugby fans for train delays Travel Rugby world cup 2015 Cardiff Wales
